term.title: flow-programmed chromatography

item.text: A procedure in which the rate of flow of the mobile phase is changed systematically during a part or the whole of the separation.

term.citation: Citation: 'flow-programmed chromatography' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.F02438

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
